title: 107_hr5198
content: The Act may be cited as the "Premier Certified Lenders Program Improvement Act of 2002". The Premier Certified Lenders Program (PCLP) has been successful in helping small businesses expand. Increasing the number of premier certified lenders will provide more resources to small businesses as the Small Business Administration downsizes. Requiring premier certified lenders to maintain large loss reserve accounts is inefficient and limits their ability to serve additional small businesses. Premier certified lenders should be required to. Requiring premier certified lenders to maintain loss reserve accounts in amounts commensurate with the risk of loss associated with the PCLP loan portfolio will protect taxpayers and improve the program's ability to help small businesses. SEC. 3. ALTERNATIVE LOSS RESERVE FOR CERTAIN PREMIER CERTIFIED LENDERS. SEC. 3. ALTERNATIVE LOSS RESERVE FOR CERTAIN PREMIER CERTIFIED LENDERS. In General, Section 508(c) of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to allow qualified high loss reserve PCLs to elect alternative loss reserve requirements in place of existing ones. Contributions may be waived for PCLs making this election. Qualified high loss reserve PCLs making the election described in subparagraph (A) for a calendar quarter are exempt from making contributions to their loss reserve during that quarter. They must make necessary contributions before the last day of the quarter to ensure their loss reserve is at least $25,000. Qualified high loss reserve PCLs must make contributions before the last day of the quarter to ensure their loss reserve is at least $25,000 and sufficient to protect the Federal Government from the risk of loss associated with their PCLP loan portfolio. The term 'qualified high loss reserve PCL' refers to premier certified lenders who have a loss reserve of at least $25,000 and analyze the risk of loss associated with their PCLP loan portfolio. The company must analyze the risk of loss for its PCLP loan portfolio and grade each loan based on risk. A third-party auditor must certify the adequacy of the company's loss reserve to protect the Federal Government from potential losses. The company's loss reserve for its PCLP loan portfolio must be certified by a third-party auditor to protect the Federal Government from potential losses. The company's loss reserve for its PCLP loan portfolio must be certified by a third-party auditor to protect the Federal Government from potential losses. The term 'PCLP loan' refers to any loan guaranteed under this section, and a 'calendar quarter' is defined as specific periods throughout the year. The term 'calendar quarter' is defined as specific periods throughout the year: (i) January 1 to March 31, (ii) April 1 to June 30, (iii) July 1 to September 30, and (iv) October 1 to December 31. Additionally, a conforming amendment was made to the Small Business Investment Act of 1958.
